programme.title: L'opéra
programme.desc: Danseuse étoile de Paris, Zoé, 35 ans vit dans l'excès après une carrière au sommet de son art. Sébastien, le nouveau directeur, menace de la renvoyer en raison des nombreuses fêtes et dissipations nocturnes. Elle décide alors de se battre pour conserver sa place.

programme.title: L'opéra
programme.desc: Pour défendre ses intérêts, Zoé fait appel à maître Delva, une avocate qui lui donne un seul conseil : être distribuée le plus possible. Pour cela, elle doit retrouver la forme.

programme.title: Boyhood
programme.desc: Mason, un garçon rêveur de 6 ans, habite avec sa sœur, Samantha, et sa mère, Olivia, dans une petite ville du Texas. Olivia, divorcée, tente de concilier, tant bien que mal, sa vie de femme avec celle de mère de famille. Une année s'est écoulée et la petite famille loge désormais à Houston. Alors qu'ils sont gardés par leur grand-mère maternelle, leur père, qui s'est installé en Alaska, passe un matin les prendre pour passer du temps avec eux. A la fin de la journée, les deux enfants constatent que les relations entre leurs parents ne sont pas apaisées.

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E5 Famille n'est pas un mot, c'est une phrase

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E6 TBT, comme ils disent

programme.title: Shock Wave 2
programme.desc: Poon Shing Fung et Tung Cheuk Man, deux brillants officiers artificiers de la police de Hongkong, sont appelés sur de périlleuses opérations de déminage. A cours de l'une d'entre elles, Shing Fung se trouve pris dans le feu d'une violente explosion, le laissant amputé d'une jambe. Désormais aidé d'une prothèse et déterminé à retrouver sa mobilité, Poon suit un programme sportif intensif, mais quitte la police. Cinq ans plus tard, un jeune homme muni d'une ceinture d'explosif commet un attentat meurtrier dans un immeuble de la ville. Selon toute vraisemblance, il appartient à un mouvement terroriste.

programme.title: Contre-enquête
programme.desc: Hélène Villon, journaliste d'investigation pour le journal « La République », reçoit un message sur son portable de Kevin Lannier. Ce militaire qu'elle avait interviewé à son retour d’Afghanistan dit vouloir lui parler rapidement. Mais quand elle arrive chez lui, il est trop tard. Le jeune homme a été retrouvé mort au pied de son immeuble. Il a chuté du toit. Alors que la police penche pour la thèse du suicide, Hélène, qui connaissait Kevin, décide de mener sa propre enquête. Lors des funérailles, elle aborde la petite amie de Kevin.

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: En 1941, à Belfast, alors que l'Irlande, plusieurs fois bombardée, subit les ravages de la guerre, le zoo de Bellevue accueille un nouveau pensionnaire de poids, un éléphanteau. Familier du directeur, monsieur Shawcross, Tom, fils de George Hall, le vétérinaire du zoo, se précipite aussitôt pour rendre visite à l'animal, qu'il baptise bien vite Buster. Mais cette bonne nouvelle est vite assombrie par une autre, quand l'adolescent apprend que son père vient d'être mobilisé et part bientôt au front.

programme.title: Boule & Bill
programme.desc: En France, en 1976, Boule, 9 ans, et ses parents s'arrêtent au chenil lors d'une promenade dominicale et ils découvrent un cocker. Malgré l'opposition du père, le chiot, baptisé Bill, est rapidement adopté. Mais, bien qu'animé de bonnes intentions, il multiplie les catastrophes. Quand la famille doit déménager pour Paris, le père tente, sans succès, d'en profiter pour se débarrasser de lui. C'est le moment où la tortue Caroline intègre la famille. Elle tombe amoureuse de Bill.

programme.title: Populaire
programme.desc: A la fin des années 50, Rose Pamphyle, qui s'est entrainée quelque temps dans l'épicerie familiale, vient d'être embauchée comme secrétaire dans le cabinet d'assurance de Louis Echard. Peu convaincu par ses talents de secrétaire mais épaté par sa rapidité, celui-ci décide d'inscrire la jeune femme à un concours de vitesse dactylographique. Après un premier échec, Louis propose à Rose de venir s'entraîner chez lui en vue de la prochaine compétition.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: A New York, en 1933, le cinéaste Carl Denham engage la jeune actrice Ann Darrow pour son prochain film qui doit se dérouler à Skull Island, à l'est de Sumatra. Inexplorée, l'île abriterait une divinité mystérieuse vénérée par les indigènes. Après un difficile voyage en mer, l'équipe du tournage débarque. Très vite, Ann est enlevé par des cannibales puis offerte en sacrifice à Kong, un singe gigantesque.

programme.title: American Pie
programme.desc: Jim, Oz, Kevin et Finch, quatre copains, décident de perdre leur virginité avant de commencer la fac. Chacun a sa méthode. Jim jette son dévolu sur Nadia, tandis qu'Oz entre dans la chorale pour séduire la prude Heather. Kevin veut convaincre sa petite amie Vicky au moyen d'une «bible» sur les plaisirs du sexe. Finch se fait passer pour un «supermâle». Toutes les filles veulent alors être sa cavalière au bal de la promo.

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: Jim, Oz, Kevin et Finch, quatre jeunes amis, entendent profiter dignement de leurs vacances. Ils louent une maison sur le bord du lac Michigan. Alors que Nadia doit rejoindre Jim à la fin de l'été, ce dernier retrouve Michelle, une flûtiste délurée auprès de laquelle il a beaucoup de choses à apprendre. Quant à Finch, il se prépare à une nouvelle rencontre avec la mère de Stiffler.

programme.title: Under Pressure
programme.desc: Quand il n'écoute pas dans sa voiture des enregistrements contenant des conseils de professionnels du poker, Gerry, lui-même joueur qui traverse une mauvaise passe, écume les salles de jeu du Sud des Etats-Unis. C'est sur l'une d'entre elles qu'il croise Curtis, un jeune joueur aussi volubile que doué, qui adore raconter nombre d'anecdotes pendant qu'il joue. Quelques heures après leur partie, les deux hommes se retrouvent dans un bar pour échanger sur leurs expériences. Gerry est vite fasciné par le côté imprévisible dans le jeu de Curtis.

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E5 Famille n'est pas un mot, c'est une phrase

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E6 TBT, comme ils disent

programme.title: JFK
programme.desc: Le 22 novembre 1963, le président Kennedy est assassiné à Dallas. Le même jour, Lee Harvey Oswald est arrêté et inculpé du meurtre. Le lendemain, il est abattu par Jack Ruby. La commission Warren conclut néanmoins à la culpabilité d'Oswald et à la présence d'un seul tireur. En 1966, les invraisemblances de ce rapport interpellent le procureur Jim Garrison, qui en réfute les conclusions et reprend l'enquête.

programme.title: Ruby
programme.desc: Dans sa jeunesse, Jack Ruby a eu des contacts avec la Mafia. Il s'est rangé depuis en ouvrant une petite boîte de strip-tease à Dallas et sert d'indicateur au FBI. Un soir, il rencontre Sheryl Ann, une jeune paumée qui devient sa protégée, et qu'il rebaptise Candy Cane.

programme.title: La prof de sport
programme.desc: Un couple fête son premier anniversaire de relation. Autour d'un gâteau et de fruits, il se mettent alors à jouer comme des gamins, un moment plein de romantisme, d'amour et de désir qui finit par une bonne baise comme au premier jour de leur rencontre.

programme.title: Very Bad Things
programme.desc: Kyle Fisher va épouser la belle mais très autoritaire Laura. Respectant la tradition, il part à Las Vegas enterrer sa vie de garçon avec ses amis de toujours, Charles, Robert, Michael et Adam. Dans un hôtel luxueux, ils se livrent à tous les excès et louent les services d'une strip-teaseuse. Mais Michael entraîne la fille dans la salle de bains et lui transperce accidentellement le crâne avec un portemanteau.

programme.title: Ça commence souvent par un je t'aime
Diabolique
programme.desc: En 1997, une vieille famille de notable de province est réunie au grand complet dans le superbe château familial. Chacun a répondu à l'invitation à déjeuner d'Hélène pour évoquer la réfection du domaine, mais les débats deviennent houleux lorsqu'elle informe ses deux frères que les subventions habituellement allouées ont été coupées. Les deux hommes refusent de participer aux frais et s'en remettent à Hélène pour trouver une solution. Elle rencontre alors un certain Thomas Texier, un charmant trentenaire débordant d'énergie et d'attention qui s'impose rapidement comme un homme providentiel.

programme.title: La légende de Despereaux
programme.desc: Dans un royaume enchanté, la reine meurt, laissant le roi et leur fille, la princesse Petit Pois, inconsolables. Arrive une souris aux grandes oreilles : Despereaux Tilling. Ce dernier se lie avec la princesse, qui lui apprend à lire les livres plutôt qu'à les manger. Il découvre alors les contes de fées, pleins d'actions héroïques. Mais, à cause de cette amitié contre nature, Despereaux est banni par les siens et échoue dans le monde des rats. Dans cet univers cruel et malodorant, il rencontre un autre marginal : le rat Roscuro, gourmet sophistiqué et grand voyageur.

programme.title: L'affaire Percy
programme.desc: En 1998, Percy Schmeiser cultivateur de colza depuis des décennies dans le Saskatchewan canadien, reçoit un courrier de la société Monsanto, lui demandant de verser la somme de 19 000 dollars pour l'utilisation de semences brevetées. Percy, qui a toujours refusé d'en utiliser, est convaincu que ces semences ont accidentellement été intégrées à ses cultures par un cultivateur voisin. L'agriculteur, qui refuse de se laisser impressionner par la puissante firme, fait appel à Jackson Weaver, d'un modeste cabinet d'avocats, pour le représenter en justice.

programme.title: Cyril contre Goliath
programme.desc: Dans son appartement parisien entouré de ses enfants, l'écrivain Cyril Montana se souvient du village de Lacoste, dans le Luberon, où il passait enfant ses vacances d'été. Il se souvient aussi que ce village, dominé par le château du Marquis de Sade, a beaucoup intéressé le créateur et homme d'affaires Pierre Cardin, qui, en 2000, a commencé à y racheter le château, puis des maisons, jusqu'à 40, et des commerces, afin de le transformer en lieu culturel. Seulement ces acquisitions ne débouchent pas sur grand-chose et Lacoste est devenu peu à peu un village-musée.

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E5 Famille n'est pas un mot, c'est une phrase

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E6 TBT, comme ils disent

programme.title: Crazy, Stupid, Love
programme.desc: Quadragénaire, Cal vit depuis vingt-cinq ans avec sa femme Emily, qui lui a donné deux beaux enfants. Sa vie bascule le jour où il apprend que cette dernière l'a trompé. Cal décide de divorcer et devient un homme solitaire. Dans un bar, il rencontre Jacob, un séducteur professionnel qui accumule les conquêtes. Il accepte de prendre Cal sous son aile et de le transformer en don juan. Les résultats ne se font pas attendre.

programme.title: Un heureux événement
programme.desc: Etudiante en philosophie, Barbara Dray fait la connaissance de Nicolas Malle, qui travaille dans un vidéoclub. Il parvient à la séduire et ils s'installent ensemble. Lors de vacances, Nicolas convainc Barbara de faire un bébé. Un jour, la jeune femme annonce à Nicolas qu'elle est enceinte. Pendant sa grossesse, Barbara passe par tous les états. Et vient enfin le jour de l'accouchement, qui se déroule sans encombre. Mais c'est le début d'une véritable détresse pour Barbara, qui ne parvient pas à se faire à cette nouvelle vie.

programme.title: Shock Wave 2
programme.desc: Poon Shing Fung et Tung Cheuk Man, deux brillants officiers artificiers de la police de Hongkong, sont appelés sur de périlleuses opérations de déminage. A cours de l'une d'entre elles, Shing Fung se trouve pris dans le feu d'une violente explosion, le laissant amputé d'une jambe. Désormais aidé d'une prothèse et déterminé à retrouver sa mobilité, Poon suit un programme sportif intensif, mais quitte la police. Cinq ans plus tard, un jeune homme muni d'une ceinture d'explosif commet un attentat meurtrier dans un immeuble de la ville. Selon toute vraisemblance, il appartient à un mouvement terroriste.

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: En 1941, à Belfast, alors que l'Irlande, plusieurs fois bombardée, subit les ravages de la guerre, le zoo de Bellevue accueille un nouveau pensionnaire de poids, un éléphanteau. Familier du directeur, monsieur Shawcross, Tom, fils de George Hall, le vétérinaire du zoo, se précipite aussitôt pour rendre visite à l'animal, qu'il baptise bien vite Buster. Mais cette bonne nouvelle est vite assombrie par une autre, quand l'adolescent apprend que son père vient d'être mobilisé et part bientôt au front.

programme.title: JFK l'enquête
programme.desc: Après avoir consacré un long métrage de fiction à l'enquête menée sur l'assassinat de John Fitzgerald Kennedy, Oliver Stone se replonge 30 ans après dans le sujet pour y consacrer désormais un documentaire. A travers une série d'images d'archives, le réalisateur reconstitue d'abord la journée du 22 novembre 1963, à Dallas, avant de présenter les prémices de l'enquête qui allait être menée. La caméra d'Oliver Stone se retrouve ensuite à Dallas, 55 ans plus tard. Le cinéaste explique alors pourquoi il revient sur les lieux du crime, et se replonge dans le contexte de l'enquête.

programme.title: Fin des programmes
programme.desc: Écrivain égoïste dépourvu d'esprit de famille, Alexandre perd son père, Jacques, foudroyé par une crise cardiaque. Mais Jacques ne disparaît pas vraiment et se manifeste à son fils sous la forme d'un fantôme avec lequel il dialogue en permanence. Tandis que les relations familiales se compliquent, tout le monde s'inquiète des changements de comportements d'Alexandre.

programme.sub-title: S4 E4 Meurtre à la carte

programme.sub-title: S4 E1 Une vie en lambeaux

programme.sub-title: S4 E5 Bons baisers de Paris

programme.title: Keeping Faith
programme.desc: Tandis que la police enquête sur l'effraction qui a eu lieu au domicile de Faith, celle-ci se rend chez Cerys pour en savoir plus sur les relations qu'Evan entretenait avec les Glynn. La relation entre Faith et Steve devient plus intime, ce qui n'échappe pas au capitaine Williams qui demande à l'agent Jones de prendre Faith en filature..

programme.title: Keeping Faith
programme.desc: La voiture d'Evan a été retrouvée sur un lieu connu pour le nombre de suicides élevés qui y sont commis. Mais aucune preuve ne laisse penser à un tel acte. Faith est à nouveau interrogée par la police, et Steve prend des risques pour l'aider..

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: La découverte stupéfiante qu'a faite Lisa dans la cave de Mark White fait prendre un tour inattendu à l'enquête. Elliott se fait rabrouer par sa collègue qui lui reproche son manque d'investissement dans les investigations. Christina rend visite au directeur du collège que sa fille fréquentait pour lui confier sa détresse. La sincérité d'Ivy est remise en cause par les inspecteurs qui décident de l'arrêter pour entrave à la justice.

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Ivy accepte de prendre de gros risques pour permettre à la police de sauver Phoebe. Elle se rend dans le centre commercial où Mark White lui a fixé rendez-vous. De nombreux policiers la surveillent à distance pour assurer sa sécurité. Mais son ravisseur parvient à l'enlever - une nouvelle fois - après avoir libéré Phoebe. La famille Moxam est plongée dans l'horreur.

programme.title: Enfer blanc
programme.desc: Alors que le Conseil de l'Arctique est sur le point de signer un accord sur l'exploitation des ressources dans cette zone, un pétrolier suédois est retrouvé à la dérive. Celui-ci a été la cible d'une attaque au large du Groenland et tout son équipage a été pris en otage.

programme.title: Enfer blanc
programme.desc: On soupçonne que la Russie pourrait être responsable de l'attaque. D'énormes réserves de pétrole ont été découvertes dans la région et la Russie offre secrètement l'indépendance du Groenland en échange des droits de forage. C'est le rêve ultime du Groenland qui pourrait être brisé par le traité.

programme.title: Elementary
Elementary
Elementary
programme.sub-title: S7 E13 S7 E13 Ihre Abschiedsvorstellung
programme.desc:
Elementary: Created by Robert Doherty. With Jonny Lee Miller, Lucy Liu, Aidan Quinn, Jon Michael Hill. A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2191671/","name":"Elementary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEyN2U1YTItNDY1Zi00YjljLWI5YzItNWU3YWViYjhiZTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2191671/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"William_G"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A different spin on a classic, A great show on its own merits","reviewBody":"Like many people, I love BBC's Sherlock and overlooked Elementary for many reasons. I recently decided to give it a chance and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. First off, don't make the same mistake I did and dismiss it for some of the rather odd sounding changes, it's intended to be a different spin on the classic and does so very well.

Jonny Lee Miller plays a great Sherlock. He's more human and flawed, where the original Sherlock was almost cartoonishly strong at times, but he still has the same confident eccentric brilliance that makes Sherlock Holmes so interesting. He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. Whether you like the different spin on Arthur Conan Doyle's characters or not, Elementary does mystery right, and it's worth a watch based on that alone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-09-27","keywords":"new york city detective,british in america,detective,modernized setting,companionship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001538/","name":"Jonny Lee Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005154/","name":"Lucy Liu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001644/","name":"Aidan Quinn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0395934/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1201266/","name":"Robert Doherty"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393551385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","description":"See what's in store in season 4 of "Elemetary.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: All the Way
Der lange Weg
programme.desc:
All the Way: Directed by Jay Roach. With Bryan Cranston, Anthony Mackie, Melissa Leo, Frank Langella. Lyndon B. Johnson becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of John F. Kennedy's assassination, and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3791216/","name":"All the Way","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUwMTRmMjYtNjI0ZC00Mzc3LTgyZGQtZTA5OTg5ZmVkZDMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQzMDg4Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. Johnson becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of John F. Kennedy's assassination, and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3791216/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"secondtake"},"dateCreated":"2016-05-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cranston is great, and the events are even greater....","reviewBody":"All the Way

An impressive cast, centered around the LBJ actor Bryan Cranston, keeps the historical facts alive and relevant.

We often forget Johnson the president between Kennedy and Nixon. He was the most responsible for Vietnam, but also for a huge range of social programs that really make him the ultimate big government guy since Roosevelt. But important programs like Medicare and social legislation like the Civil Rights Act and the Voting Act. Seeing him struggle to make it happen is a kind of poker game, and he does it with famously Johnson candor and humor.

There's no getting around the fact that these are facts. There are no dramatic surprises here (so it's like seeing a movie the second time). But it's a good movie—one that you can see a second time and get a lot from it. There are weak points (some miscast figures like, unfortunately, Martin Luther King Jr. who is played by Anthony Mackie), but overall the drama of the events is kept intense and pertinent.

And Cranston is sublime. If you know him from "Breaking Bad" you will surprised by his depth here. See him, at least. And Johnson, too.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13876,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2016-05-21","keywords":"j. edgar hoover character,lyndon b. johnson character,jacqueline kennedy character,dallas texas,year 1963","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3039999001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. Johnson (Bryan Cranston) becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of JFK's assassination and spends his first year in office to quickly pass the Civil Rights Act."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186505/","name":"Bryan Cranston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1107001/","name":"Anthony Mackie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502425/","name":"Melissa Leo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005366/","name":"Jay Roach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0490948/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0770938/","name":"Robert Schenkkan"}],"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

An impressive cast, centered around the LBJ actor Bryan Cranston, keeps the historical facts alive and relevant.

We often forget Johnson the president between Kennedy and Nixon. Seeing him struggle to make it happen is a kind of poker game, and he does it with famously Johnson candor and humor.

There's no getting around the fact that these are facts. There are no dramatic surprises here (so it's like seeing a movie the second time). But it's a good movie—one that you can see a second time and get a lot from it. There are weak points (some miscast figures like, unfortunately, Martin Luther King Jr. who is played by Anthony Mackie), but overall the drama of the events is kept intense and pertinent.

And Cranston is sublime. If you know him from "Breaking Bad" you will surprised by his depth here. See him, at least. And Johnson, too.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13876,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2016-05-21","keywords":"j. edgar hoover character,lyndon b. johnson character,jacqueline kennedy character,dallas texas,year 1963","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3039999001","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. The Pacific Theatre of World War II, as seen through the eyes of several young Marines." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0374463/","name":"The Pacific","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmEwNmI1MjItNjNjYy00NDE5LWJiNTYtM2QxMTI5ZjllZTBhL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Pacific Theatre of World War II, as seen through the eyes of several young Marines.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0374463/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gezmek","dateCreated":"2010-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well worth the time","reviewBody":"I enjoyed this series very much and can see why there has been so many comparisons with Band Of Brothers. My observation is that in The Pacific many of the characters lack depth and development. The result was that I cared less when ill befell them than I did in Band of Brothers. I think that the first episode could have contained a lot more time letting us get to know the characters better before throwing them into battle.\n\nThe battle scenes were done very well and played very realistically. All in all HBO has done it again. Without the HBO and Showtime I think that US grown TV drama would be pretty thin on the ground. The Pacific is well worth the time.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":106218,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2010-03-14","keywords":"world war two,pacific theater,japanese soldier,u.s. marine corps,horrors of war","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0197647/","name":"James Badge Dale","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001515/","name":"Joseph Mazzello","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781218/","name":"Jon Seda"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040938/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pacific: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3159819545","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1NjM2NDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgxMDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1NjM2NDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgxMDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A 10-part mini-series ftelling the intertwined stories of three Marines during America's battle with the Japanese in the Pacific during World War II."</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 9308346, Title: The Plot Against America, --- Description: The Plot Against America: Created by Ed Burns, David Simon. With Winona Ryder, Anthony Boyle, Zoe Kazan, Morgan Spector. Characters live in an alternative history in which Franklin D. Roosevelt was defeated in the U.S. presidential election of 1940 by Charles Lindbergh." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt9308346/","name":"The Plot Against America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk2NzdhMTItMGRmYS00NGQxLTlkMWQtYmI0MWNlNDJjNWMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Characters live in an alternative history in which Franklin D. Roosevelt was defeated in the U.S. presidential election of 1940 by Charles Lindbergh.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9308346/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michaeljcummings","dateCreated":"2020-03-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Adaptation of an Excellent Novel","reviewBody":"This is an adaptation of a Philip Roth novel. Philip Roth was a great American novelist, possibly the last great American novelist. He died two years ago at 85. One of his themes is optimism turning to pessimism and then back to a more mature optimism. This is not a flashy story: you are not going to find "The Handmaid's Tale" here, nor any depictions of the Third Reich in the U.S.A. You are going to find a story about how U.S. isolationism could have changed the course of history from 1940 on, with devastating results. You are also going to find the quality of production that was once synonymous with HBO. Having read the book, I can say that the story is going to go in some fairly grim directions. But you shouldn't watch this expecting flash: instead, watch it for a vibrant story, brilliant characterizations, and great themes...such as what it means to be American. It doesn't hurt that some very good actors who have rarely been fully utilized have some excellent material to work with. I think Morgan Spector, Winona Ryder, and especially Zoe Kazan - she is the foundation of the story - are all outstanding.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9108,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-16","keywords":"alternate history,tv mini series,american history,world war two,alternative reality","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4996269/","name":"Anthony Boyle","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1443740/","name":"Zoe Kazan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0747900/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0122654/","name":"Ed Burns","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800108/","name":"David Simon"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi357416729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRjN2U5ZjgtN2M2Yi00NDc5LWFlMTMtMTcxNmFhOWNjZWM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRjN2U5ZjgtN2M2Yi00NDc5LWFlMTMtMTcxNmFhOWNjZWM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"An alternate American history story of the country's turn to fascism told through the eyes of a working-class Jewish family in New Jersey"</script><metacontent="

Roosevelt was defeated in the U.S. presidential election of 1940 by Charles Lindbergh." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt9308346/","name":"The Plot Against America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk2NzdhMTItMGRmYS00NGQxLTlkMWQtYmI0MWNlNDJjNWMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Characters live in an alternative history in which Franklin D. Roosevelt was defeated in the U.S. presidential election of 1940 by Charles Lindbergh.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9308346/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michaeljcummings","dateCreated":"2020-03-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Adaptation of an Excellent Novel","reviewBody":"This is an adaptation of a Philip Roth novel. Philip Roth was a great American novelist, possibly the last great American novelist. He died two years ago at 85. One of his themes is optimism turning to pessimism and then back to a more mature optimism. This is not a flashy story: you are not going to find "The Handmaid's Tale" here, nor any depictions of the Third Reich in the U.S.A. You are going to find a story about how U.S. isolationism could have changed the course of history from 1940 on, with devastating results. You are also going to find the quality of production that was once synonymous with HBO. Having read the book, I can say that the story is going to go in some fairly grim directions. But you shouldn't watch this expecting flash: instead, watch it for a vibrant story, brilliant characterizations, and great themes...such as what it means to be American. It doesn't hurt that some very good actors who have rarely been fully utilized have some excellent material to work with. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 9308346, Title: The Plot Against America, --- Description: The Plot Against America: Created by Ed Burns, David Simon. With Winona Ryder, Anthony Boyle, Zoe Kazan, Morgan Spector. Characters live in an alternative history in which Franklin D. Roosevelt was defeated in the U.S. presidential election of 1940 by Charles Lindbergh." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt9308346/","name":"The Plot Against America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk2NzdhMTItMGRmYS00NGQxLTlkMWQtYmI0MWNlNDJjNWMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Characters live in an alternative history in which Franklin D. Roosevelt was defeated in the U.S. presidential election of 1940 by Charles Lindbergh.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9308346/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michaeljcummings","dateCreated":"2020-03-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Adaptation of an Excellent Novel","reviewBody":"This is an adaptation of a Philip Roth novel. Philip Roth was a great American novelist, possibly the last great American novelist. He died two years ago at 85. One of his themes is optimism turning to pessimism and then back to a more mature optimism. This is not a flashy story: you are not going to find "The Handmaid's Tale" here, nor any depictions of the Third Reich in the U.S.A. You are going to find a story about how U.S. isolationism could have changed the course of history from 1940 on, with devastating results. You are also going to find the quality of production that was once synonymous with HBO. Having read the book, I can say that the story is going to go in some fairly grim directions. But you shouldn't watch this expecting flash: instead, watch it for a vibrant story, brilliant characterizations, and great themes...such as what it means to be American. It doesn't hurt that some very good actors who have rarely been fully utilized have some excellent material to work with. I think Morgan Spector, Winona Ryder, and especially Zoe Kazan - she is the foundation of the story - are all outstanding.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9108,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-16","keywords":"alternate history,tv mini series,american history,world war two,alternative reality","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4996269/","name":"Anthony Boyle","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1443740/","name":"Zoe Kazan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0747900/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0122654/","name":"Ed Burns","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800108/","name":"David Simon"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi357416729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRjN2U5ZjgtN2M2Yi00NDc5LWFlMTMtMTcxNmFhOWNjZWM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRjN2U5ZjgtN2M2Yi00NDc5LWFlMTMtMTcxNmFhOWNjZWM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"An alternate American history story of the country's turn to fascism told through the eyes of a working-class Jewish family in New Jersey"</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10482370, Title: The Third Day, --- Description: The Third Day: Created by Felix Barrett, Dennis Kelly. With Jude Law, John Dagleish, Mark Lewis Jones, Paddy Considine. A man and a woman make separate journeys to a mysterious island off the British coast." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10482370/","name":"The Third Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVlMGEzMTctY2U0ZS00M2RmLTlhZGItZTM4MDU1M2Q0YzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjEwNTM2Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man and a woman make separate journeys to a mysterious island off the British coast.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10482370/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"wendajones","dateCreated":"2020-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Strange but riveting","reviewBody":"I've now watched the first three episodes and want to react before watching the next three. I must say it was very, very strange but very, very alluring viewing. Jude Law was absolutely magnificent, as in fact he always is but here he was just so good. Peculiar camera shots, reality lapses and all sorts of funny things but for Jude Law's performance alone I really enjoyed it. Still not sure about the "meaning" but am not worried about that too much! The next day! So now I've watched the next three episodes and my judgement remains. I can really understand why some people don't appreciate this. We all have really different tastes. But i found it compelling to use a word I don't normally use! In parts so exciting that I had to pause and do something else for a few minutes before continuing. The ending was a little disappointing but I don't know how else it could have ended really. The reality that was created was very gripping and as usual I managed to work in an allegory to some things in our real world! Don't watch if all you want is a straight forward horror movie though!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9212,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-09-14","keywords":"tv mini series,folk horror,london england,island,causeway","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2742856/","name":"John Dagleish","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428765/","name":"Mark Lewis Jones"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0751666/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0716013/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10908075/","name":"Felix Barrett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2393111/","name":"Dennis Kelly"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3832462873","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU4MDJiZTYtNTNjNi00NWE0LTgwN2MtNzI0MDk4ODQ4MzZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU4MDJiZTYtNTNjNi00NWE0LTgwN2MtNzI0MDk4ODQ4MzZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Told over two sets of episodes, a man and woman are drawn to a mysterious island off the British coast, where they encounter a group of islanders set on preserving their traditions at any cost."</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10482370, Title: The Third Day, --- Description: The Third Day: Created by Felix Barrett, Dennis Kelly. With Jude Law, John Dagleish, Mark Lewis Jones, Paddy Considine. A man and a woman make separate journeys to a mysterious island off the British coast." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10482370/","name":"The Third Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVlMGEzMTctY2U0ZS00M2RmLTlhZGItZTM4MDU1M2Q0YzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjEwNTM2Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man and a woman make separate journeys to a mysterious island off the British coast.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10482370/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"wendajones","dateCreated":"2020-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Strange but riveting","reviewBody":"I've now watched the first three episodes and want to react before watching the next three. I must say it was very, very strange but very, very alluring viewing. Jude Law was absolutely magnificent, as in fact he always is but here he was just so good. Peculiar camera shots, reality lapses and all sorts of funny things but for Jude Law's performance alone I really enjoyed it. Still not sure about the "meaning" but am not worried about that too much! The next day! So now I've watched the next three episodes and my judgement remains. I can really understand why some people don't appreciate this. We all have really different tastes. But i found it compelling to use a word I don't normally use! In parts so exciting that I had to pause and do something else for a few minutes before continuing. The ending was a little disappointing but I don't know how else it could have ended really. The reality that was created was very gripping and as usual I managed to work in an allegory to some things in our real world! Don't watch if all you want is a straight forward horror movie though!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9212,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-09-14","keywords":"tv mini series,folk horror,london england,island,causeway","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2742856/","name":"John Dagleish","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428765/","name":"Mark Lewis Jones"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0751666/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0716013/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10908075/","name":"Felix Barrett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2393111/","name":"Dennis Kelly"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3832462873","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU4MDJiZTYtNTNjNi00NWE0LTgwN2MtNzI0MDk4ODQ4MzZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU4MDJiZTYtNTNjNi00NWE0LTgwN2MtNzI0MDk4ODQ4MzZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Told over two sets of episodes, a man and woman are drawn to a mysterious island off the British coast, where they encounter a group of islanders set on preserving their traditions at any cost."</script><metacontent="

Angels in America
programme.sub-title: S1 E3 S1 E3 Der Bote
programme.desc: Angels in America: With Al Pacino, Mary-Louise Parker, Justin Kirk, Jeffrey Wright. Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0318997/","name":"Angels in America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlM2RhNTgtYTQxMy00ZmJkLWIxNDQtOTQzYjg5Y2Y4YjUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318997/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"psychopathicgroupie"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"a must-see and one of my all-time favorites.","reviewBody":"Angels in America is definitely one of my favorites. I was a loyal viewer when it was on HBO, and rushed out to buy the DVD when it was released. I think this miniseries was very tastefully done. I was delighted to see such diversity in the movie. It was very refreshing to see Jews, Mormons, Protestants, Homosexuals, Heterosexuals, Republicans, and Democrats together. I think this movie was very real in it's portrayal of AIDS, and it really raised awareness for me, because it showed AIDS as a real disease, not just something we hear about on the news. I was very excited to see minorities presented like average, real people. I didn't see the play, so i can't compare. but i was thoroughly pleased with Mike Nichols direction, i think the cast was incredible, and brought life to each character in the best way possible. i think Mary-Louise Parker especially brought with her character, Harper Pitt, something to the play that was very difficult to do. Harper, other than her marriage to Joe, was irrelevant to the story; Parker was able to take the character, though, and make Harper one of the most insightful and endearing characters in the show. I especially like Justin Kirk in this movie. He did not have a particularly challenging part, but he really grabbed my heart in a subtle way. I have heard much criticism directed toward Al Pacino. However, i think Pacino did very well as is character. I have little knowledge of the real Cohn, but Pacinio was able to give Cohn an evil personality, while still keeping the audience aware of how human Cohn really is. It was very interesting. I was also very pleased with the characters of Belize and Mother Pitt. I found Angels in America very inspiring, and after seeing it for the first time, I seemed to see the world in a whole new light. I know that sounds cheesy, but it is true. For someone very passionate about equal rights, like me, this movie seemed to relay exactly what I stand for. If you are an easily offended Conservative, this movie may not be for you, but I recommend this to anyone with an open mind.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27229,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-07","keywords":"hiv,death,loneliness,valium,heaven","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094563/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Angels in America","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3786801433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.category: Drama, Fantasy, Romance, Drama, Fantasy, Romance
programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0318997, Title: Angels in America, --- Description: Angels in America: With Al Pacino, Mary-Louise Parker, Justin Kirk, Jeffrey Wright. Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0318997/","name":"Angels in America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlM2RhNTgtYTQxMy00ZmJkLWIxNDQtOTQzYjg5Y2Y4YjUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318997/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"psychopathicgroupie","dateCreated":"2004-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"a must-see and one of my all-time favorites.","reviewBody":"Angels in America is definitely one of my favorites. I was a loyal viewer when it was on HBO, and rushed out to buy the DVD when it was released. I think this miniseries was very tastefully done. I was delighted to see such diversity in the movie. It was very refreshing to see Jews, Mormons, Protestants, Homosexuals, Heterosexuals, Republicans, and Democrats together. I think this movie was very real in it's portrayal of AIDS, and it really raised awareness for me, because it showed AIDS as a real disease, not just something we hear about on the news. I was very excited to see minorities presented like average, real people. I didn't see the play, so i can't compare. but i was thoroughly pleased with Mike Nichols direction, i think the cast was incredible, and brought life to each character in the best way possible. i think Mary-Louise Parker especially brought with her character, Harper Pitt, something to the play that was very difficult to do. Harper, other than her marriage to Joe, was irrelevant to the story; Parker was able to take the character, though, and make Harper one of the most insightful and endearing characters in the show. I especially like Justin Kirk in this movie. He did not have a particularly challenging part, but he really grabbed my heart in a subtle way. I have heard much criticism directed toward Al Pacino. However, i think Pacino did very well as is character. I have little knowledge of the real Cohn, but Pacinio was able to give Cohn an evil personality, while still keeping the audience aware of how human Cohn really is. It was very interesting. I was also very pleased with the characters of Belize and Mother Pitt. I found Angels in America very inspiring, and after seeing it for the first time, I seemed to see the world in a whole new light. I know that sounds cheesy, but it is true. For someone very passionate about equal rights, like me, this movie seemed to relay exactly what I stand for. If you are an easily offended Conservative, this movie may not be for you, but I recommend this to anyone with an open mind.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27229,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-07","keywords":"hiv,death,loneliness,valium,heaven","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094563/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Angels in America","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3786801433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0318997, Title: Angels in America, --- Description: Angels in America: With Al Pacino, Mary-Louise Parker, Justin Kirk, Jeffrey Wright. Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0318997/","name":"Angels in America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlM2RhNTgtYTQxMy00ZmJkLWIxNDQtOTQzYjg5Y2Y4YjUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318997/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"psychopathicgroupie","dateCreated":"2004-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"a must-see and one of my all-time favorites.","reviewBody":"Angels in America is definitely one of my favorites. I was a loyal viewer when it was on HBO, and rushed out to buy the DVD when it was released. I think this miniseries was very tastefully done. I was delighted to see such diversity in the movie. It was very refreshing to see Jews, Mormons, Protestants, Homosexuals, Heterosexuals, Republicans, and Democrats together. I think this movie was very real in it's portrayal of AIDS, and it really raised awareness for me, because it showed AIDS as a real disease, not just something we hear about on the news. I was very excited to see minorities presented like average, real people. I didn't see the play, so i can't compare. but i was thoroughly pleased with Mike Nichols direction, i think the cast was incredible, and brought life to each character in the best way possible. i think Mary-Louise Parker especially brought with her character, Harper Pitt, something to the play that was very difficult to do. Harper, other than her marriage to Joe, was irrelevant to the story; Parker was able to take the character, though, and make Harper one of the most insightful and endearing characters in the show. I especially like Justin Kirk in this movie. He did not have a particularly challenging part, but he really grabbed my heart in a subtle way. I have heard much criticism directed toward Al Pacino. However, i think Pacino did very well as is character. I have little knowledge of the real Cohn, but Pacinio was able to give Cohn an evil personality, while still keeping the audience aware of how human Cohn really is. It was very interesting. I was also very pleased with the characters of Belize and Mother Pitt. I found Angels in America very inspiring, and after seeing it for the first time, I seemed to see the world in a whole new light. I know that sounds cheesy, but it is true. For someone very passionate about equal rights, like me, this movie seemed to relay exactly what I stand for. If you are an easily offended Conservative, this movie may not be for you, but I recommend this to anyone with an open mind.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27229,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-07","keywords":"hiv,death,loneliness,valium,heaven","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094563/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Angels in America","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3786801433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"</script><metacontent="

I was a loyal viewer when it was on HBO, and rushed out to buy the DVD when it was released. I think this miniseries was very tastefully done. I was delighted to see such diversity in the movie. It was very refreshing to see Jews, Mormons, Protestants, Homosexuals, Heterosexuals, Republicans, and Democrats together. I think this movie was very real in it's portrayal of AIDS, and it really raised awareness for me, because it showed AIDS as a real disease, not just something we hear about on the news. I was very excited to see minorities presented like average, real people. I didn't see the play, so i can't compare. but i was thoroughly pleased with Mike Nichols direction, i think the cast was incredible, and brought life to each character in the best way possible. i think Mary-Louise Parker especially brought with her character, Harper Pitt, something to the play that was very difficult to do. Harper, other than her marriage to Joe, was irrelevant to the story; Parker was able to take the character, though, and make Harper one of the most insightful and endearing characters in the show. I especially like Justin Kirk in this movie. He did not have a particularly challenging part, but he really grabbed my heart in a subtle way. I have heard much criticism directed toward Al Pacino. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0318997, Title: Angels in America, --- Description: Angels in America: With Al Pacino, Mary-Louise Parker, Justin Kirk, Jeffrey Wright. Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0318997/","name":"Angels in America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlM2RhNTgtYTQxMy00ZmJkLWIxNDQtOTQzYjg5Y2Y4YjUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318997/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"psychopathicgroupie","dateCreated":"2004-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"a must-see and one of my all-time favorites.","reviewBody":"Angels in America is definitely one of my favorites. I was a loyal viewer when it was on HBO, and rushed out to buy the DVD when it was released. I think this miniseries was very tastefully done. I was delighted to see such diversity in the movie. It was very refreshing to see Jews, Mormons, Protestants, Homosexuals, Heterosexuals, Republicans, and Democrats together. I think this movie was very real in it's portrayal of AIDS, and it really raised awareness for me, because it showed AIDS as a real disease, not just something we hear about on the news. I was very excited to see minorities presented like average, real people. I didn't see the play, so i can't compare. but i was thoroughly pleased with Mike Nichols direction, i think the cast was incredible, and brought life to each character in the best way possible. i think Mary-Louise Parker especially brought with her character, Harper Pitt, something to the play that was very difficult to do. Harper, other than her marriage to Joe, was irrelevant to the story; Parker was able to take the character, though, and make Harper one of the most insightful and endearing characters in the show. I especially like Justin Kirk in this movie. He did not have a particularly challenging part, but he really grabbed my heart in a subtle way. I have heard much criticism directed toward Al Pacino. However, i think Pacino did very well as is character. I have little knowledge of the real Cohn, but Pacinio was able to give Cohn an evil personality, while still keeping the audience aware of how human Cohn really is. It was very interesting. I was also very pleased with the characters of Belize and Mother Pitt. I found Angels in America very inspiring, and after seeing it for the first time, I seemed to see the world in a whole new light. I know that sounds cheesy, but it is true. For someone very passionate about equal rights, like me, this movie seemed to relay exactly what I stand for. If you are an easily offended Conservative, this movie may not be for you, but I recommend this to anyone with an open mind.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27229,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-07","keywords":"hiv,death,loneliness,valium,heaven","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094563/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Angels in America","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3786801433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0318997, Title: Angels in America, --- Description: Angels in America: With Al Pacino, Mary-Louise Parker, Justin Kirk, Jeffrey Wright. Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0318997/","name":"Angels in America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlM2RhNTgtYTQxMy00ZmJkLWIxNDQtOTQzYjg5Y2Y4YjUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Playwright Tony Kushner adapted his political epic about the AIDS crisis during the mid 1980s and centers the story around a group of disparate but connected individuals.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318997/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"psychopathicgroupie","dateCreated":"2004-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"a must-see and one of my all-time favorites.","reviewBody":"Angels in America is definitely one of my favorites. I was a loyal viewer when it was on HBO, and rushed out to buy the DVD when it was released. I think this miniseries was very tastefully done. I was delighted to see such diversity in the movie. It was very refreshing to see Jews, Mormons, Protestants, Homosexuals, Heterosexuals, Republicans, and Democrats together. I think this movie was very real in it's portrayal of AIDS, and it really raised awareness for me, because it showed AIDS as a real disease, not just something we hear about on the news. I was very excited to see minorities presented like average, real people. I didn't see the play, so i can't compare. but i was thoroughly pleased with Mike Nichols direction, i think the cast was incredible, and brought life to each character in the best way possible. i think Mary-Louise Parker especially brought with her character, Harper Pitt, something to the play that was very difficult to do. Harper, other than her marriage to Joe, was irrelevant to the story; Parker was able to take the character, though, and make Harper one of the most insightful and endearing characters in the show. I especially like Justin Kirk in this movie. He did not have a particularly challenging part, but he really grabbed my heart in a subtle way. I have heard much criticism directed toward Al Pacino. However, i think Pacino did very well as is character. I have little knowledge of the real Cohn, but Pacinio was able to give Cohn an evil personality, while still keeping the audience aware of how human Cohn really is. It was very interesting. I was also very pleased with the characters of Belize and Mother Pitt. I found Angels in America very inspiring, and after seeing it for the first time, I seemed to see the world in a whole new light. I know that sounds cheesy, but it is true. For someone very passionate about equal rights, like me, this movie seemed to relay exactly what I stand for. If you are an easily offended Conservative, this movie may not be for you, but I recommend this to anyone with an open mind.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27229,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-07","keywords":"hiv,death,loneliness,valium,heaven","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094563/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Angels in America","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3786801433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0NDZkNWYtMzk0Zi00ZDZlLTkwODYtNWMwZTVlZWE4ZTcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Missing in Action 2: The Beginning
Missing in Action 2 – Die Rückkehr
programme.desc:
Missing in Action 2: The Beginning: Directed by Lance Hool. With Chuck Norris, Soon-Tek Oh, Steven Williams, Bennett Ohta. Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0089604/","name":"Missing in Action 2: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzODkyODg4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTQ2NjE2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0089604/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"HarryLags"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Missing in Action 2: The Beginning is his most personal mission of all!","reviewBody":"When we last left Colonel James Braddock, he was shoving it up Vietnamese butt by barging into their press conference about how they didn't have any POWs in Vietnam with a POW he just rescued. Truly a fairy tale ending, but what about the beginning of the fairy tale? Missing in Action 2: The Beginning is his most personal mission of all! Because it's when he was a POW himself! Which we already saw in sporadic flashbacks in the first movie.

Missing in Action 2: The Beginning shows the capture of Colonel Braddock (Chuck Norris) during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape. Norris and his crew are holed up in a prison camp for the whole picture, ruled by tyrannical Colonel Yin (Soon-Tek Oh) who resorts to psychological mind games, torture and murder to try to make Braddock sign a statement admitting to war atrocities he never committed.

There seems to be no end to the different scenarios and interesting scenes that play out during the film: escape attempts, arranged fights between prisoners, a guy who stumbles onto the prison camp and gets executed. Things really start to pick up when Braddock gets really mad and you see him sneaking here and there, setting bombs, picking off people one by one, freeing people, blowing up stuff, and staying behind after everyone leaves because he doesn't believe Yin really died when he bombed Yin's hut. 

But Chuck really delivers in the end, especially in his final feel good showdown with Yin. In my opinion, Missing in Action 2: The Beginning is the best of the Braddock movies, it's part action film and part action drama, which sets it apart from the other movies.

The first time i ever watched this film was in the early 80's in the cinema and it was great, and i still think it's great...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8212,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1985-03-01","keywords":"hairy chest,prequel,vietnam war veteran,soldier,missing in action","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001569/","name":"Chuck Norris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0644902/","name":"Soon-Tek Oh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931736/","name":"Steven Williams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393678/","name":"Lance Hool"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044937/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0206391/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082893/","name":"Steve Bing"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506062/","name":"Larry Levinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798649/","name":"Arthur Silver"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Absolution
Mercenary: Absolution
programme.desc: Absolution: Directed by Keoni Waxman. With Steven Seagal, Byron Mann, Howard Dell, Adina Stetcu. Contract killer John Alexander (Steven Seagal, "Under Siege") has a chance to save an innocent girl from a powerful mob boss, but protecting her means betraying the government agency that hired him and putting his own life at risk." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3503840/","name":"Absolution","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NjY0NzYzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM2MzI4NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Contract killer John Alexander (Steven Seagal, "Under Siege") has a chance to save an innocent girl from a powerful mob boss, but protecting her means betraying the government agency that hired him and putting his own life at risk.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3503840/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Uriah43"},"dateCreated":"2016-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Going to a Gunfight with Just a Knife","reviewBody":""John Alexander" (Steven Seagal) is an assassin who has been very successful with what he does for a living. So capable in fact, that he now believes that he needs to atone for the many bad things he has done over the course of his life. He gets this opportunity following a successful contract hit in Ukraine when he finds himself caught up in the middle of a situation involving a prostitute named "Nadia" (Adina Stetcu) and a murderous, sexual pervert with enormous influence who goes by the title of "the Boss" (Vinnie Jones). However, what he doesn't fully appreciate is just how influential "the Boss" actually is and because of that he becomes a target himself. Now rather than reveal any more I will just say that this movie actually started off pretty good. Unfortunately, it proceeded to get more and more unrealistic as the film progressed with several scenes involving both John Alexander and his friend "Chi" (Byron Mann) willingly throwing down their firearms in order to defeat their fully-armed opponents using only their martial arts skills. Naturally, I could understand this scenario if they were caught off-guard or if they had exhausted all of their ammunition while exchanging gunfire. But professionals don't go to a gunfight armed with just a knife or their bare knuckles. It just doesn't happen. That said, those who enjoy martial arts action for its own sake might really like this movie. But those who want a semblance of reality might be a bit disappointed. In any case, while it wasn't necessarily a bad film, it could have been better and for that reason I have rated it accordingly. Average.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3362,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-05-15","keywords":"time bomb,ukraine,weapon,nightclub shootout,car","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Absolution","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2094774809","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTk1NzkwNjktMTNjYy00YjI3LWJkNDUtZjM3NTZkMzRkYzQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTk1NzkwNjktMTNjYy00YjI3LWJkNDUtZjM3NTZkMzRkYzQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Absolution"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000219/","name":"Steven Seagal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0542677/","name":"Byron Mann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0217320/","name":"Howard Dell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915394/","name":"Keoni Waxman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0507691/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064174/","name":"Richard Beattie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915394/","name":"Keoni Waxman"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3503840, Title: Absolution, --- Description: Absolution: Directed by Keoni Waxman. With Steven Seagal, Byron Mann, Howard Dell, Adina Stetcu. Contract killer John Alexander (Steven Seagal, "Under Siege") has a chance to save an innocent girl from a powerful mob boss, but protecting her means betraying the government agency that hired him and putting his own life at risk." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3503840/","name":"Absolution","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NjY0NzYzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM2MzI4NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Contract killer John Alexander (Steven Seagal, "Under Siege") has a chance to save an innocent girl from a powerful mob boss, but protecting her means betraying the government agency that hired him and putting his own life at risk.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3503840/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Uriah43","dateCreated":"2016-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Going to a Gunfight with Just a Knife","reviewBody":""John Alexander" (Steven Seagal) is an assassin who has been very successful with what he does for a living. So capable in fact, that he now believes that he needs to atone for the many bad things he has done over the course of his life. He gets this opportunity following a successful contract hit in Ukraine when he finds himself caught up in the middle of a situation involving a prostitute named "Nadia" (Adina Stetcu) and a murderous, sexual pervert with enormous influence who goes by the title of "the Boss" (Vinnie Jones). However, what he doesn't fully appreciate is just how influential "the Boss" actually is and because of that he becomes a target himself. Now rather than reveal any more I will just say that this movie actually started off pretty good. Unfortunately, it proceeded to get more and more unrealistic as the film progressed with several scenes involving both John Alexander and his friend "Chi" (Byron Mann) willingly throwing down their firearms in order to defeat their fully-armed opponents using only their martial arts skills. Naturally, I could understand this scenario if they were caught off-guard or if they had exhausted all of their ammunition while exchanging gunfire. But professionals don't go to a gunfight armed with just a knife or their bare knuckles. It just doesn't happen. That said, those who enjoy martial arts action for its own sake might really like this movie. But those who want a semblance of reality might be a bit disappointed. In any case, while it wasn't necessarily a bad film, it could have been better and for that reason I have rated it accordingly.
